Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

More than 1400 people are currently being held in long-term detention at the for-profit GEO immigrant detention facility in Aurora. Multiple news reports and investigations have uncovered abuse, neglect, and a disturbing lack of access to basic medical care for detainees. Negligence and poor treatment at the facility have led to multiple outbreaks and quarantines.

The Aurora City Council has finally started to take note of the problems at the GEO facility. This Monday, they will consider an initial measure to require GEO to inform the public any time there is an outbreak or health hazard at the facility.

Contact the Council today and encourage them to support accountability and transparency at the for-profit GEO Detention Center.

Take Action

This ordinance is a start. So much more needs to be done at the state and local level to address the humanitarian issues at the facility.

In April, we sued ICE over their refusal to provide information about the death of Kamyar Samimi while he was held at GEO. That suit is pending. In the coming months, weâ€™ll provide more calls to action and ways to get involved in creating transparency and accountability at the Aurora facility.

In the meantime, please help us use this opportunity before the Aurora City Council to encourage the councilmembers to do more to hold ICE and GEO accountable for mistreatment of immigrant detainees in their facility.
